p: Sepsis is a major cause of death and morbidity worldwide [ 8, 12]. The current approaches in managing sepsis patients include initial resuscitation, early diagnosis to allow prompt treatment using specific antibiotics, and identification of infection source and control measures [ 2]. These have improved the outcomes of sepsis patients; however, the mortality rate remains unreasonably high [ 4]. Furthermore, the reliance on antibiotics may exacerbate the global threat of multidrug-resistant organisms, leaving no treatment option for sepsis [ 149]. An alternative approachâ€”a specific antisepsis treatment, is urgently needed to ease the global burden of sepsis due to the tremendous costs incurred in the management of patients [ 8]. Hence, this review aims to give some insights into Malaysian herbal plants and their active constituents which have the potential to be further developed into alternative treatments for sepsis.
